definition: Great Bauhinia Medal (GBM), Hong Kong's highest honor

sentences.english: Look at his chest, flooded with British and foreign medals.
sentences.chinese: 看他前胸都戴满了国内和国外的勋章。

sentences.english: Robinson was awarded the Presidential Medal of Freedom by Obama in 2009.
sentences.chinese: 罗宾逊2009年接受了奥巴马颁发的总统自由勋章。

sentences.english: Enlisted recipients of the Medal of Honor are entitled to a supplemental uniform allowance.
sentences.chinese: 荣誉勋章获得者将有资格获得军人的津贴。

sentences.english: President Gerald Ford presented her with the Medal of Freedom in nineteen seventy-seven.
sentences.chinese: 在1977年杰拉尔德福特总统颁发给她自由勋章。

sentences.english: Fess - Military belt or girdle of honor.
sentences.chinese: 军装上的腰带或勋章带。

sentences.english: Your bravery and heroism earned you medals and recognition from the Alliance fleet.
sentences.chinese: 你的英勇善战为你赢得了联盟舰队的勋章和认可。

sentences.english: Electronic Arts is no doubt hoping that Medal of Honor will make it a lot of money.
sentences.chinese: 电子艺界无疑希望《荣誉勋章》能大赚一笔。

sentences.english: On both these occasions I received medals and was even mentioned in despatches.
sentences.chinese: 这两次我都获得了勋章，连新闻报道都提到了我。

sentences.english: I am a bit-ch when I wanna be.
sentences.chinese: 我也想申请勋章，那个终身成就勋章。

sentences.english: I am a bit-ch when I wanna be.
sentences.chinese: 我也想申请勋章，那个终身成就勋章。

sentences.english: He was Prefect, Head Boy , and received a Medal for Magical Merit.
sentences.chinese: 他是级长，还获得了梅林魔法勋章。

sentences.english: He became a Hero of Socialist Labor (1975) and was twice awarded the Order of Lenin.
sentences.chinese: 年获社会主义劳动英雄称号，两次获得列宁勋章。

sentences.english: The government recognized his outstanding service by giving him a medal.
sentences.chinese: 政府为他颁赠勋章，以表彰他的“卓着”功绩。

sentences.english: A US military decoration awarded for meritorious service.
sentences.chinese: 美国军队奖给值得表彰的服务的勋章。

sentences.english: The Emperor gave him the cross.
1862 - Medal of Honor authorised by the United States Congress.
sentences.chinese: 1862年的今天，美国国会通过颁发荣誉勋章。
